qas.question: When did Apple begin shipping computers with CD-RW drives?
What did Apple begin offering as standard features meant for playing DVD's?
Who admitted that Apple was late to the party with writable CD technology?
Which Apple campaign did some people feel encouraged media piracy?
What is the name of one of Apple's unsuccessful products?
When did Microsoft begin shipping computers with CD-RW drives?
What did Microsoft begin offering as standard features meant for playing DVD's?
Who admitted that Microsoft was late to the party with writable CD technology?
Which Apple campaign did some people feel discouraged media piracy?
What is the name of one of Apple's successful products?

context: In <a0_0><b5_0>early 2001<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Apple began shipping computers with CD-RW drives and emphasized the Mac's ability to play DVDs by including <a1_0><b6_0>DVD-ROM and DVD-RAM drives<b6_0/><a1_0/> as standard. <a2_0><b7_0>Steve Jobs<b7_0/><a2_0/> admitted that Apple had been "late to the party" on writable CD technology, but felt that Macs could become a "digital hub" that linked and enabled an "emerging digital lifestyle". Apple would later introduce an update to its iTunes music player software that enabled it to burn CDs, along with a controversial <a3_0>"<b8_0>Rip, Mix, Burn<b8_0/>"<a3_0/> advertising campaign that some felt encouraged media piracy. This accompanied the release of the iPod, Apple's first successful handheld device. Apple continued to launch products, such as the unsuccessful <a4_0><b9_0>Power Mac G4 Cube<b9_0/><a4_0/>, the education-oriented eMac, and the titanium (and later aluminium) PowerBook G4 laptop for professionals.
